sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: The XR-2000 is a high-performance enterprise router designed for demanding network environments. It provides advanced routing capabilities, robust security features, and exceptional reliability.

subsections.title: Product Overview
subsections.content: The XR-2000 router offers enterprise-grade performance with up to 10 Gbps throughput and support for up to 500 simultaneous VPN connections.

subsections.title: Package Contents
subsections.content: Router unit, power adapter, Ethernet cable, mounting brackets, quick start guide, and warranty card.

sections.title: Safety Information
sections.content: Please read all safety instructions before operating the device. Failure to follow these guidelines may result in equipment damage or personal injury.

subsections.title: Electrical Safety
subsections.content: Use only the supplied power adapter. Do not expose the device to moisture or extreme temperatures.

sections.content: Detailed technical specifications and performance characteristics of the XR-2000 router.

warnings_and_cautions.content: Disconnect power before servicing. High voltage present. Refer servicing to qualified personnel only.
Do not open the device enclosure. No user-serviceable parts inside. Opening the case will void warranty.
Ensure adequate ventilation. Do not block air vents. Maintain 2 inches clearance on all sides.
Use only approved power adapters. Using incompatible power supplies may damage the device.
Configuration changes take effect immediately. Save configuration to flash memory to persist across reboots.
Default credentials should be changed during initial setup for security purposes.

steps.instruction: Unpack the router and verify all components are present
steps.notes: Report missing items to your supplier immediately

steps.instruction: Choose a suitable mounting location with adequate ventilation
steps.notes: Ambient temperature should be within 0-40°C

steps.instruction: Connect the power adapter to the router and plug into AC outlet
steps.notes: Power LED should illuminate green within 30 seconds

steps.instruction: Connect your computer to any LAN port using an Ethernet cable
steps.notes: Use a standard CAT5e or better cable

steps.instruction: Open a web browser and navigate to https://192.168.1.1
steps.notes: Accept the security certificate warning on first connection

steps.instruction: Login using default credentials (admin/admin)
steps.notes: You will be prompted to change password on first login

steps.instruction: Follow the setup wizard to configure WAN connection
steps.notes: Select appropriate connection type (DHCP, Static, PPPoE)

steps.instruction: Configure LAN settings and DHCP parameters
steps.notes: Default DHCP range is 192.168.1.100-200

steps.instruction: Apply settings and wait for router to reboot
steps.notes: Reboot typically takes 2-3 minutes

steps.instruction: Verify internet connectivity and save configuration
steps.notes: Use the 'Save Configuration' button to persist settings

steps.instruction: Locate the recessed Reset button on the rear panel
steps.notes: A paperclip or pin is required to press the button

steps.instruction: With the router powered on, press and hold the Reset button
steps.notes: Hold for exactly 10 seconds

steps.instruction: Release the button when the Status LED begins blinking amber
steps.notes: This indicates reset is in progress

steps.instruction: Wait for the router to complete the reset process
steps.notes: All LEDs will cycle and router will reboot (approximately 3 minutes)

steps.instruction: Verify reset by logging in with default credentials
steps.notes: All custom settings will be lost

steps.instruction: Download the latest firmware from the manufacturer website
steps.notes: Verify firmware file integrity using provided MD5 checksum

steps.instruction: Log into the router web interface
steps.notes: Ensure stable power during firmware update

steps.instruction: Navigate to System > Firmware Update
Click 'Choose File' and select the downloaded firmware file
steps.notes: File should have .bin extension

steps.instruction: Click 'Upload and Install' to begin the update
steps.notes: Do not power off or reset during this process

steps.instruction: Wait for upload and verification to complete
steps.notes: Progress bar will show upload status (typically 2-5 minutes)

steps.instruction: Router will automatically reboot after installation
steps.notes: Allow 3-5 minutes for reboot and initialization

steps.instruction: Log back in and verify firmware version under System > About
steps.notes: Configuration is preserved during firmware updates
